title: A Whig Manifesto: A Short History of the Whig Movement with Modern Whig Party Perspectives on Current Political and Social Controversies
features: The modern Whig movement and, specifically, the Modern Whig Party is a quickly growing third party in America and this book examines its political philosophy. Drawing from the history and traditions of the party—those that animated the public policies and careers of such great American Whigs as George Washington, Alexander Hamilton, Henry Clay, John Quincy Adams, Daniel Webster, and Abraham Lincoln—this book explains the set of core beliefs that Whigs believe are essential to American governance. It goes on to relate how Whig ideology can be applied to current governmental issues today, touching upon the mortgage crisis, taxes, civil rights, and health care. Making the case for American political and economic nationalism, this manifesto offers insights into a uniquely American philosophy that fostered the most successful and prosperous nation in history.
description: Chuck Morse is the host of Chuck Morse Speaks Podcast, available at Blogtalkradio, Podomatic, iTunes and elsewhere and Chuck Morse Speaks TV on Boston Neighborhood News and YouTube. A frequent radio guest and fill-in host, Mr. Morse is the author of non-fiction books, available at Amazon and his columns  have appeared in The Washington Times, The Boston Globe, The Providence Journal, The New Bedford Standard Times, Newsmax, Front Page and WND.
Chuck Morse can be reached at (617) 271-5044 / chuckmorse4@gmail.com.
